posts.cooked:
Hello everyone, My and my programming coach have been trying to get a live display on the frc driver station through a webcam using python, which seems like a very simple task. We have tried QuickVision and AxisCamera on the 2024 robotpy examples, and we have also tried the instructions at wpilib; however, non of them work. When click play on the dashboard, all that shows up is a black screen. There are no errors and everything deploys properly too. We have also tried using a different webcam and a different roborio.

Links to code we used: AxisCamera - https://github.com/robotpy/examples/tree/main/AxisCamera wpilib instructions - Basic Vision Example — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

QuickVision - It is in the same repository as the AxisCamera example, but chiefdelphi isn’t letting me use 3 links in my post.

Thank you for any help!

link_counts.title: Basic Vision Example — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

posts.name: Dustin Spicuzza
posts.cooked:
Which dashboard?

What messages are displayed on netconsole/riolog?
This is on the frc driver station dashboard. However, sorry I do not remember what messages came up but there were no errors messages when deploying and enabling.

posts.name: Dustin Spicuzza
posts.cooked:
I didn’t ask for error messages, I asked what messages were there? cscore shows messages for various events.

Also, what packages are installed on your roborio? You can see the list by doing py -m robotpy installer list . If robotpy-cscore isn’t on the list, then that’s your problem.

posts.name: Dustin Spicuzza
posts.cooked:
I tried it on my rio at home and I’m getting an error message, so there’s something wrong. Currently thinking that the rio is running out of memory. Tracking at QuickVision example fails with SIGABRT · Issue #61 · robotpy/mostrobotpy · GitHub

Are you using a RoboRIO 1?

link_counts.title: QuickVision example fails with SIGABRT · Issue #61 · robotpy/mostrobotpy · GitHub

posts.cooked: Yeah we were testing on robo rio 1

posts.name: Dustin Spicuzza
posts.cooked:
I did a bunch of things to try to reduce the memory footprint of things, so you might have better results if you upgrade everything:

On internet:

On rio network:

The other thing you should consider doing is turning off the NI webserver, it takes up a lot of memory and mostly doesn’t do anything.

You mostly only need it to set the IP address of your robot. If there is ever a time you need to enable it again:
